info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued November 20 at 3:15PM CST until November 20 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN VERNON PARISH IN WEST CENTRAL LOUISIANA AND NORTHEASTERN NEWTON COUNTIES... At 315 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Burr Ferry, or near Burkeville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Leesville, Anacoco, Toledo Bend Dam, Fort Johnson, New Llano, Burr Ferry, Evans, and Pickering. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for west central Louisiana...and southeastern Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
